title.narrative: CROSS-SECTORAL INTERVENTIONS

description.narrative: Cross sectoral activities to support delivery of results to children, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Cross sectoral activities to support delivery of results to children

description.narrative: During 2021, the GCO significantly grew its social media presence through dedicated engagement with its followers, campaigns and initiatives. While C4D activities were impacted by the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, targeted digital activations and distributions of;print C4D material during Q3 and Q4 were key for meeting set targets in addition to the recruitment of dedicated staff supporting C4D. Additionally, the UNICEF WASH programme in Lesvos met its key targets and site residents were reached with critical WASH supplies and services in 2021. Through this programme, the GCO established itself as a sector lead alongside the Government. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:24/01/2022
